node.title: Academy "condemns" Will Smith's actions at Oscars, launches formal review
node.description: "The Academy does not condone violence of any form," the organization said after the telecast.

node.title: Cruise ship docks in San Francisco with COVID-19 cases on board
node.description: The same Princess Cruise ship has seen infections arise despite passengers and crew being vaccinated.

node.title: Springfield residents told to 'sit and wait' for fresh water supply one year on
node.description: Residents of a Canterbury town have been depending on drinking water from a tanker for nearly a year and it is likely they will continue for another year.

node.title: Thousands of Mariupol civilians taken to Russia
node.description: Ukraine has accused Russia of forcibly relocating thousands of civilians from Mariupol, the strategic port city devastated by Russian shelling.

node.title: Can we flood-proof our homes?
node.description: Extreme weather events, like last week's flash flooding in Auckland, are becoming more frequent. The Detail asks whether there's anything more we can do to protect ourselves and our homes.

node.title: Tesla plans 2nd stock split in less than 2 years
node.description: Shares of electric car maker accelerate, boosted increased manufacturing capacity in the U.S. and Europe.

node.title: A look at Will Smith and Chris Rock's history leading up to the 2022 Oscars
node.description: The incident may seems like just another moment from one of Hollywood's biggest nights, but it's far from it.

node.title: Blue Origin set for 4th crewed sub-orbital space flight
node.description: The capsule's chief designer gets a chance to fly after comedian Pete Davidson withdrew due to a schedule conflict.

node.title: Oscars 2022 recap - Jane Campion wins Best Director, Will Smith Best Actor
node.description: Jane Campion has won Best Director for The Power of the Dog, CODA took Best Picture while Best Actor winner Will Smith caused shock by slapping presenter Chris Rock for an insensitive joke.

node.title: All Whites battle past Tahiti
node.description: The All Whites are through to the final of the Oceania World Cup qualifying tournament in Qatar after beating Tahiti 1-nil in their semi-final.

node.title: Hundreds opt for Novavax in first two weeks of rollout
node.description: Just over 1300 doses of the Novavax Covid-19 vaccine have been given in the first two weeks it has been available.

node.title: Moana Pasifika ready to back up after maiden Super Rugby win
node.description: Moana Pasifika have rung the changes for Tuesday's rescheduled match against the Blues, with 11 players to debut.

node.title: Government unsure on keeping NZ presence in Solomons if China troops arrive
node.description: The government is undecided on withdrawing the Defence Force from the Solomons if Chinese soldiers are stationed there, the prime minister says.

node.title: Florida Gov. DeSantis signs controversial education bill into law
node.description: The bill received heavy pushback from the LGBTQ+ community and allies, who have called it an "attack."

node.title: Will Smith smacks Chris Rock at Oscars
node.description: Will Smith won his first Academy Award moments after smacking presenter Chris Rock on stage for making a joke about his wife and swearing twice.

node.title: What is a no-fly zone, and why won't the U.S. enforce one over Ukraine?
node.description: The United States and NATO have, so far, rejected President Zelenskyy's pleas for a no-fly zone. Here is a look at what a no-fly zone is, and why there isn't one over Ukraine.

node.title: Judge: Trump "more likely than not" illegally tried to block Congress on Jan. 6
node.description: Carter ordered Eastman to turn over 101 documents to the House select committee investigating the January 6 assault on the U.S. Capitol.

node.title: Collins first NZ snowboarder to win the FIS Snowboard Crystal Globe
node.description: Queenstown's Tiarn Collins has become the first New Zealander to ever claim a FIS Snowboard Crystal Globe.

node.title: Possible closure of St George's Hospital's maternity unit sad for parents - Gemma McCaw
node.description: Nearly 20,000 people have signed a petition to save one of Christchurch's birthing units.

node.title: Verstappen wins in Jeddah
node.description: Formula one champion Max Verstappen swept past Ferrari rival Charles Leclerc four laps from the finish to take his first win of the season at the Saudi Arabian Grand Prix.

node.title: 'Open heart surgery': Roof removal a breakthrough on $154m cathedral restoration
node.description: Christ Church Cathedral restorers hope construction workers can venture inside the building by Christmas.

node.title: In the spotlight: New Zealanders at the Oscars through the years
node.description: How often do Kiwis in the film industry get recognised by the Academy? New Zealand's history with the golden statue goes all the way back to 1980.

node.title: Iditarod punishes 3 mushers for sheltering dogs in fierce windstorm
node.description: "Cruelty is baked into this deadly race, and it's time for it to stop," PETA said in a statement.

node.title: 63 million Americans in the crosshairs of dangerous storms
node.description: Alabama, Louisiana, Mississippi and Texas — all of which saw tornado warnings last week — could potentially see them again over the next few days.

node.title: Jada Pinkett Smith brings public awareness to alopecia
node.description: Pinkett Smith said her diagnosis was "terrifying" and that she discovered handfuls of her hair were falling out in the shower.

node.title: Online video shows girl fatally shooting cousin and herself
node.description: "They were playing with the gun, when they shouldn't have been," the girl's grandmother said.

node.title: Biden administration unveils 2023 federal budget proposal
node.description: The more than $5.7 trillion proposal is just the first step in the lengthy budget process.

node.title: Russia to bar entry for people from growing list of "unfriendly" nations
node.description: Putin's war in Ukraine has brought an unprecedented "economic blitzkrieg" down on his own country. This is an effort at "retaliatory" measures.

node.title: Top Russian newspaper forced to halt publication over Ukraine war
node.description: The paper said it had received a second warning from Russia's media regulator - meaning a Russian court could shut it down.

node.title: Could Will Smith's slap cost him his Oscar?
node.description: The academy's code of standards asks its members to behave ethically and uphold its "values of respect for human dignity, inclusion and a supportive environment that fosters creativity."
